title: Leading causes of death among black U.S. residents in 2017
yAxis: Percentage of all causes of death
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
Month Diseases of the heart has the highest Percentage of all causes of death and Septicemia has the lowest Percentage of all causes of death.
The highest Month Diseases of the heart has 21.3 more Percentage of all causes of death than the lowest Month Septicemia.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
Month Diseases of the heart has the highest Percentage of all causes of death and Septicemia has the lowest Percentage of all causes of death.
The highest Month Diseases of the heart has 21.3 more Percentage of all causes of death than the lowest Month Septicemia.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of all causes of death for 10 number of Months.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
Month Malignant neoplasms (cancers) has the second highest value for Percentage of all causes of death.
There is a difference of 21.3 between the maximum Month Diseases of the heart and minimum Month Septicemia.

The Month Diseases of the heart has the highest Percentage of all causes of death, followed by Malignant neoplasms (cancers), and Accidents (unintentional injuries). Down to the Month Septicemia which is the lowest.
Overall Percentage of all causes of death has declined over the Months.
The lowest value 2.0 at Septicemia is almost 3.15 times smaller than the average value 7.39.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 73.9.

data.Month: Nephritis nephrotic syndrome and nephrosis (kidney diseases)
